trans-unit.source: Quick start guide: Machine Learning Recommendations API | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Quick start guide: Machine Learning Recommendations API | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations - Quick Start Guide
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations - Quick Start Guide

trans-unit.source: Quick start guide for the Machine Learning Recommendations API
trans-unit.target: Quick start guide for the Machine Learning Recommendations API

trans-unit.source: This document describes how to onboard your service or application to use Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Recommendations.
trans-unit.target: This document describes how to onboard your service or application to use Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Recommendations.

trans-unit.source: You can find more details on the Recommendations API in the [gallery](http://gallery.cortanaanalytics.com/MachineLearningAPI/Recommendations-2).
trans-unit.target: You can find more details on the Recommendations API in the [gallery](http://gallery.cortanaanalytics.com/MachineLearningAPI/Recommendations-2).

trans-unit.source: To use Azure Machine Learning Recommendations, you need to take the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To use Azure Machine Learning Recommendations, you need to take the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Create a model - A model is a container of your usage data, catalog data and the recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: Create a model - A model is a container of your usage data, catalog data and the recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Import catalog data - A catalog contains metadata information on the items.
trans-unit.target: Import catalog data - A catalog contains metadata information on the items.

trans-unit.source: Import usage data - Usage data can be uploaded in one of 2 ways (or both):
trans-unit.target: Import usage data - Usage data can be uploaded in one of 2 ways (or both):

trans-unit.source: By uploading a file that contains the usage data.
trans-unit.target: By uploading a file that contains the usage data.

trans-unit.source: Usually you upload a usage file in order to be able to create an initial recommendation model (bootstrap) and use it until the system gathers enough data by using the data acquisition format.
trans-unit.target: Usually you upload a usage file in order to be able to create an initial recommendation model (bootstrap) and use it until the system gathers enough data by using the data acquisition format.

trans-unit.source: Build a recommendation model - This is an asynchronous operation in which the recommendation system takes all the usage data and creates a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: Build a recommendation model - This is an asynchronous operation in which the recommendation system takes all the usage data and creates a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: This operation can take several minutes or several hours depending on the size of the data and the build configuration parameters.
trans-unit.target: This operation can take several minutes or several hours depending on the size of the data and the build configuration parameters.

trans-unit.source: When triggering the build, you will get a build ID.
trans-unit.target: When triggering the build, you will get a build ID.

trans-unit.source: Use it to check when the build process has ended before starting to consume recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Use it to check when the build process has ended before starting to consume recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Consume recommendations - Get recommendations for a specific item or list of items.
trans-unit.target: Consume recommendations - Get recommendations for a specific item or list of items.

trans-unit.source: All the steps above are done through the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API.
trans-unit.target: All the steps above are done through the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API.

trans-unit.source: You can download a sample application that implements each of these steps from the [gallery as well.](http://1drv.ms/1xeO2F3)
trans-unit.target: You can download a sample application that implements each of these steps from the [gallery as well.](http://1drv.ms/1xeO2F3)

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of models per subscription is 10.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of models per subscription is 10.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of items that a catalog can hold is 100,000.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of items that a catalog can hold is 100,000.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of usage points that are kept is ~5,000,000.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of usage points that are kept is ~5,000,000.

trans-unit.source: The oldest will be deleted if new ones will be uploaded or reported.
trans-unit.target: The oldest will be deleted if new ones will be uploaded or reported.

trans-unit.source: The maximum size of data that can be sent in POST (e.g. import catalog data, import usage data) is 200MB.
trans-unit.target: The maximum size of data that can be sent in POST (e.g. import catalog data, import usage data) is 200MB.

trans-unit.source: The number of transactions per second for a recommendation model build that is not active is ~2TPS.
trans-unit.target: The number of transactions per second for a recommendation model build that is not active is ~2TPS.

trans-unit.source: A recommendation model build that is active can hold up to 20TPS.
trans-unit.target: A recommendation model build that is active can hold up to 20TPS.

trans-unit.source: Authentication Micosoft Azure Marketplace supports either the Basic or OAuth authentication method.
trans-unit.target: Authentication Micosoft Azure Marketplace supports either the Basic or OAuth authentication method.

trans-unit.source: You can easily find the account keys by navigating to the keys in the marketplace under [your account settings](https://datamarket.azure.com/account/keys).
trans-unit.target: You can easily find the account keys by navigating to the keys in the marketplace under [your account settings](https://datamarket.azure.com/account/keys).

trans-unit.source: Service URI The service root URI for the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations APIs is [here.](https://api.datamarket.azure.com/amla/recommendations/v2/)
trans-unit.target: Service URI The service root URI for the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations APIs is [here.](https://api.datamarket.azure.com/amla/recommendations/v2/)

trans-unit.source: The full service URI is expressed using elements of the OData specification.
trans-unit.target: The full service URI is expressed using elements of the OData specification.

trans-unit.source: Each API call will have, at the end, a query parameter called apiVersion that should be set to "1.0".
trans-unit.target: Each API call will have, at the end, a query parameter called apiVersion that should be set to "1.0".

trans-unit.source: IDs, returned by any of the APIs, are case sensitive and should be used as such when passed as parameters in subsequent API calls.
trans-unit.target: IDs, returned by any of the APIs, are case sensitive and should be used as such when passed as parameters in subsequent API calls.

trans-unit.source: For instance, model IDs and catalog IDs are case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: For instance, model IDs and catalog IDs are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.

trans-unit.source: If you upload several catalog files to the same model with several calls, we will insert only the new catalog items.
trans-unit.target: If you upload several catalog files to the same model with several calls, we will insert only the new catalog items.

trans-unit.source: Existing items will remain with the original values.
trans-unit.target: Existing items will remain with the original values.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)

trans-unit.source: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.

trans-unit.source:
Format:
`,,[,]`

NameMandatoryTypeDescription
Item IdYesAlphanumeric, max length 50Unique identifier of an item
Item NameYesAlphanumeric, max length 255Item name
Item CategoryYesAlphanumeric, max length 255Category to which this item belongs (e.g. Cooking Books, Drama…)
DescriptionNoAlphanumeric, max length 4000Description of this item

Maximum file size is 200MB.

Example:
2406e770-769c-4189-89de-1c9283f93a96,Clara Callan,Book
21bf8088-b6c0-4509-870c-e1c7ac78304a,The Forgetting Room: A Fiction (Byzantium Book),Book
3bb5cb44-d143-4bdd-a55c-443964bf4b23,Spadework,Book
552a1940-21e4-4399-82bb-594b46d7ed54,Restraint of Beasts,Book
trans-unit.target:
Format:
`,,[,]`

NameMandatoryTypeDescription
Item IdYesAlphanumeric, max length 50Unique identifier of an item
Item NameYesAlphanumeric, max length 255Item name
Item CategoryYesAlphanumeric, max length 255Category to which this item belongs (e.g. Cooking Books, Drama…)
DescriptionNoAlphanumeric, max length 4000Description of this item

Maximum file size is 200MB.

Example:
2406e770-769c-4189-89de-1c9283f93a96,Clara Callan,Book
21bf8088-b6c0-4509-870c-e1c7ac78304a,The Forgetting Room: A Fiction (Byzantium Book),Book
3bb5cb44-d143-4bdd-a55c-443964bf4b23,Spadework,Book
552a1940-21e4-4399-82bb-594b46d7ed54,Restraint of Beasts,Book

trans-unit.source: `Feed\entry\content\properties\ErrorCount` - Number of lines that were not inserted due to an error.
trans-unit.target: `Feed\entry\content\properties\ErrorCount` - Number of lines that were not inserted due to an error.

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to upload usage data by using a file.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to upload usage data by using a file.

trans-unit.source: You can call this API several times with usage data.
trans-unit.target: You can call this API several times with usage data.

trans-unit.source: All usage data will be saved for all calls.
trans-unit.target: All usage data will be saved for all calls.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)

trans-unit.source: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.

trans-unit.source:
Format:
`,[,,]`

NameMandatoryTypeDescription
User IdYesAlphanumericUnique identifier of a user
Item IdYesAlphanumeric, max length 50Unique identifier of an item
TimeNoDate in format: YYYY/MM/DDTHH:MM:SS (e.g. 2013/06/20T10:00:00)Time of data
EventNo, if supplied then must also put dateOne of the following:
• Click
• RecommendationClick
• AddShopCart
• RemoveShopCart
• Purchase

Maximum file size is 200MB.

Example:
149452,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
6360,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
50321,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
71285,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
224450,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
236645,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
107951,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
trans-unit.target:
Format:
`,[,,]`

NameMandatoryTypeDescription
User IdYesAlphanumericUnique identifier of a user
Item IdYesAlphanumeric, max length 50Unique identifier of an item
TimeNoDate in format: YYYY/MM/DDTHH:MM:SS (e.g. 2013/06/20T10:00:00)Time of data
EventNo, if supplied then must also put dateOne of the following:
• Click
• RecommendationClick
• AddShopCart
• RemoveShopCart
• Purchase

Maximum file size is 200MB.

Example:
149452,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
6360,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
50321,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
71285,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
224450,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
236645,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347
107951,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347

trans-unit.source: `Feed\entry\content\properties\ErrorCount` - Number of lines that were not inserted due to an error.
trans-unit.target: `Feed\entry\content\properties\ErrorCount` - Number of lines that were not inserted due to an error.

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to send events in real time to Azure Machine Learning Recommendations, usually from your website.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to send events in real time to Azure Machine Learning Recommendations, usually from your website.

trans-unit.source: Event data entry for each event you want to send.
trans-unit.target: Event data entry for each event you want to send.

trans-unit.source: You should send for the same user or browser session the same ID in the SessionId field.
trans-unit.target: You should send for the same user or browser session the same ID in the SessionId field.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)

trans-unit.source: Note that if you use spaces you must encode it with %20 instead.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you use spaces you must encode it with %20 instead.

trans-unit.source: You will get a build ID as a response.
trans-unit.target: You will get a build ID as a response.

trans-unit.source: To know when the build has ended, you should call the "Get Builds Status of a Model" API and locate this build ID in the response.
trans-unit.target: To know when the build has ended, you should call the "Get Builds Status of a Model" API and locate this build ID in the response.

trans-unit.source: Note that a build can take from minutes to hours depending on the size of the data.
trans-unit.target: Note that a build can take from minutes to hours depending on the size of the data.

trans-unit.source: You cannot consume recommendations till the build ends.
trans-unit.target: You cannot consume recommendations till the build ends.

trans-unit.source: Queued – Model build was triggered and it is queued.
trans-unit.target: Queued – Model build was triggered and it is queued.

trans-unit.source: Error – Build ended with a failure.
trans-unit.target: Error – Build ended with a failure.

trans-unit.source: Note that the build ID can be found under the following path: `Feed\entry\content\properties\Id`
trans-unit.target: Note that the build ID can be found under the following path: `Feed\entry\content\properties\Id`

trans-unit.source: Get build status of a model
trans-unit.target: Get build status of a model

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether to return all the build history of the model or only the status of the most recent build.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether to return all the build history of the model or only the status of the most recent build.

trans-unit.source: The response includes one entry per build.
trans-unit.target: The response includes one entry per build.

trans-unit.source: Each entry has the following data:
trans-unit.target: Each entry has the following data:

trans-unit.source: Can be one of the following: Error, Building, Queued, Cancelling, Cancelled, Success
trans-unit.target: Can be one of the following: Error, Building, Queued, Cancelling, Cancelled, Success

trans-unit.source: `feed/entry/content/properties/StatusMessage` – Detailed status message (applies only to specific states).
trans-unit.target: `feed/entry/content/properties/StatusMessage` – Detailed status message (applies only to specific states).

trans-unit.source: `feed/entry/content/properties/ProgressStep` – Details about the current stage that a build in progress is in.
trans-unit.target: `feed/entry/content/properties/ProgressStep` – Details about the current stage that a build in progress is in.

trans-unit.source: Created – Build request entry was created.
trans-unit.target: Created – Build request entry was created.

trans-unit.source: Queued – Build request was triggered and it is queued.
trans-unit.target: Queued – Build request was triggered and it is queued.

trans-unit.source: Error – Build ended with a failure.
trans-unit.target: Error – Build ended with a failure.

trans-unit.source: (For rank build details, please refer to the "Machine Learning Recommendation API documentation" document.)
trans-unit.target: (For rank build details, please refer to the "Machine Learning Recommendation API documentation" document.)

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated list of the items to recommend for.
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated list of the items to recommend for.

trans-unit.source: The response includes one entry per recommended item.
trans-unit.target: The response includes one entry per recommended item.

trans-unit.source: Each entry has the following data:
trans-unit.target: Each entry has the following data:

trans-unit.source: `Feed\entry\content\properties\Rating` - Rating of the recommendation; higher number means higher confidence.
trans-unit.target: `Feed\entry\content\properties\Rating` - Rating of the recommendation; higher number means higher confidence.

trans-unit.source: The example response below includes 10 recommended items:
trans-unit.target: The example response below includes 10 recommended items:

trans-unit.source: Update model You can update the model description or the active build ID.
trans-unit.target: Update model You can update the model description or the active build ID.

trans-unit.source: *Active build ID* - Every build for every model has a build ID.
trans-unit.target: *Active build ID* - Every build for every model has a build ID.

trans-unit.source: The active build ID is the first successful build of every new model.
trans-unit.target: The active build ID is the first successful build of every new model.

trans-unit.source: Once you have an active build ID and you do additional builds for the same model, you need to explicitly set it as the default build ID if you want to.
trans-unit.target: Once you have an active build ID and you do additional builds for the same model, you need to explicitly set it as the default build ID if you want to.

trans-unit.source: When you consume recommendations, if you do not specify the build ID that you want to use, the default one will be used automatically.
trans-unit.target: When you consume recommendations, if you do not specify the build ID that you want to use, the default one will be used automatically.

trans-unit.source: This mechanism enables you - once you have a recommendation model in production - to build new models and test them before you promote them to production.
trans-unit.target: This mechanism enables you - once you have a recommendation model in production - to build new models and test them before you promote them to production.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the model (case sensitive)

trans-unit.source:
``
` New Description`
` -1`
``

Note that the XML tags Description and ActiveBuildId are optional.
trans-unit.target:
``
` New Description`
` -1`
``

Note that the XML tags Description and ActiveBuildId are optional.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want to set Description or ActiveBuildId, remove the entire tag.
trans-unit.target: If you do not want to set Description or ActiveBuildId, remove the entire tag.
